essay.prompt: Briefly explain the following terms: (a) Optical flow (b) SIFT (c) Histogram (d) K-nearest neighbour classification (e) HSV color space.

criteria.description: Defines optical flow as apparent pixel motion between frames and explains its role in motion estimation.
Explains Scale-Invariant Feature Transform for keypoint detection and descriptor matching.
Describes histograms as statistical distributions of intensity or color values in an image.
Describes KNN as a distance-based classifier using feature similarity.
Explains the components of hue, saturation, and value and their perceptual significance.

rubric.grading_notes: Award partial credit for accurate but incomplete definitions. Full credit requires both definition and context of use in computer vision.

essay.prompt: Describe the main principles of the following and give one example of their usage: (a) Hough transform (b) RANSAC (c) Mahalanobis distance.

criteria.description: Describes parameter space voting for detecting geometric shapes such as lines or circles.
Explains Random Sample Consensus as a method for model estimation in the presence of outliers.
Defines Mahalanobis distance as a covariance-scaled metric for multivariate data comparison.
Provides clear examples demonstrating real-world usage of each concept.

rubric.grading_notes: Full credit requires a clear example for each method. Partial credit for correct principles without examples.

notes_for_integration.formatting: JSON-only structured output for automated ingestion.
